meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise, as of an explosion or a shot.
meanings.sent1: The bam of the fireworks startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud bam coming from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The bam of the door slamming shut made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The bam of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The bam of the car crash echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit suddenly and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He bam the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She bam the table in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chef will bam the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The boxer bam his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The hammer will bam the nail into the wall.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the suddenness or force of an action or event.
meanings.sent1: She ran bam into the room, out of breath.
meanings.sent2: He lifted the heavy box bam onto the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit disappear bam!
meanings.sent4: The news spread bam throughout the small town.
meanings.sent5: The storm hit bam, causing chaos in the city.
